## Demo Vacuum Tubes


# Carbon's four bonds
Carbon is a **tetravalent** element (has four valence electrons).
Can form long chains of molecules.

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="95%"}
::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
![[An example of an experiment that takes methane diluted in H$_2$ gas to create acetylene.](https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2019/ra/c9ra05964d)](figures/30/carbon-chemistry.svg){#fig-CH2-2-C2H2 fig-align="center"}
:::
:::
:::: 

**Organic Compound** - Any chemical composed of carbon-carbon or carbon-hydrogen bonds.

# Allotropes of Carbon

Having four valence electrons means carbon can combine into many different shapes.

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="95%"}
::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
![[(A) Diamond (B) Graphite (C) Buckminsterfullerene (D) Carbon nanotube](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Eight_Allotropes_of_Carbon.svg)](figures/30/Allotropes_of_Carbon.svg){#fig-allotropes-of-carbon fig-align="center"}
:::
:::
:::: 

**Shape determines function!**
